Legal_Issue: Whether the Respondents breached the duty of fairness in revoking Mr. Diabo's membership
Governing_Law: Duty of fairness in administrative decisions
Application_Facts: Mr. Diabo was removed without notice or a hearing; Band Council lacked authority under the Membership Code
Decision_Outcome: Band Council's decision set aside; Mr. Diabo reinstated as member
Court_Ruling: Membership reinstated; declaratory relief denied due to insufficient evidence
Defendant_Behavior: Revoked membership without notice or hearing; acted beyond authority
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of procedural fairness, unauthorized decision-making
Legal_Standard: Duty of fairness requires notice and opportunity to respond
Assessment_Factor: Procedural flaws in membership revocation process
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision; consolidation of proceedings
Review_Standard: Reasonableness and compliance with procedural fairness
Evidence_Used: Provisions of the Membership Code, procedural record
Legal_Provision_Cited: Membership Code provisions on revocation authority
Application_Basis: Administrative law principles of natural justice
Evidence_Assessed: Existence of proper procedures under the Membership Code
Governing_Rule: The duty of fairness requires notice and opportunity to respond before affecting rights
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to support declaratory relief for earlier decisions
Outcome: Membership reinstated; costs to be determined
Harm_Assessment: Loss of membership rights without procedural safeguards
Cause_Description: Dispute over Mr. Diabo's membership status and its revocation by the Band Council
Evidence_Handling: Evaluation of procedural compliance with Membership Code
Legal_Provision_Violated: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
Evidence_Issues: Lack of documented notice or hearing
Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of Band Council vs. the band under the Membership Code
Evidence_Assessment: Procedural flaws rendered alternative remedies inadequate
Decision_Rationale: Violation of fairness; lack of authority; inadequate alternative remedy
Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of formal process in revocation
Legal_Standard_Applied: Duty of fairness in administrative contexts
